page.content: {The only remaining working CLARION {HOUSE in the country is at ROUGHLEE. Nelson branch of the{IndependentLabour {Party}was founded in 1892, with about 40 members. Membership increasedrapid- ly, and a number of educational and recreational activities organised. In 1899 a cottage was rented in Thorney- holme Square, where they could meet to relax at weekend.It was their first CLARION HOUSE.In 1902 they moved to larger premises at Nabs Farm, by Spen- {brook.In June 1912 membership was 1000 and the I.L.P. bought a plot in Jinny Lane and built the 3rd CLARION HOUSE. Anyone, was welcome. It had a field with swings where children could play, and became very popular.By 1945{popul- {arity waned,but a crowd of100 gathered {for Golden Jubilee Celebrations in1962 Support dwindled again,but recent revival due to interest in walking etc
